page.title: 06Farming
page.content: Sheep run with cattle & give 1.5 -2 lambs a head each year. A large pig rearing enterprise is sited on the disused railway. Turkeys are produced for the Christmas Trade. Although sprays against pests & dis- eases are used widely, together with fertilizers & much ploughing done there remain 2 ridge & furrow fields. Post & rail fences or hedges mark the field boundaries & old mixed coverts house a variety of wild-life. One new plantation is hoped to replace elms destroyed by the recent outbreak of Dutch Elm Disease. Hens & ducks provide eggs & poultry for the farm kitchen. Dogs are worked & cats keep down the mice & rats. The traditional farm life continues but using mechanical & computer knowledge to improve production.
